data.text: @GeneralAstrid You don’t have to. Check my timeline. I watched it 3 days ago. You’ll see it.
@The_5th_Turtle I'll be waiting! 😊😊😊
@GeneralAstrid I actually did the other night. You’ll be able to see my review on that too.
@The_5th_Turtle I love your movie review! It's entertaining 😂 I highly suggest you to watch the sequel 😂😂😂
@The_5th_Turtle The books are worth a read, tbh!
@RebekahNLuv Wow. Honestly that’s something I would’ve liked in the movie. That sounds pretty interesting

@The_5th_Turtle Actually, Cressida Cowell gave him that name. It means “accident”. In the books, (SPOILER ALERT) Hiccup wasn’t supposed to live. He was supposed to have been cast out as a baby for being born a runt, but neither Valhallarama nor Stoick could do it, so they kept his size a secret.

I loved the character arc for both of them as well. Animated movies have the luxury of never needing to change or age up a character, but they actually went the extra mile & made it that much better. Overall How To Train Your Dragon is absolutely fantastic. Great movie! (2/2) https://t.co/JUDyTDwuXm

How To Train Your Dragon is a fantastically animated kids movie. This is not only Dreamworks best franchise by far, but I feel this is the first time in their history where they were better than Pixar. Really good cast, great emotional connection between Hiccup & Toothless. (1/2)
Wow. I like how they changed Hiccup at the end by giving him a metal leg. It’s great character growth & development.
This movie has to stop making me believe that main character is dead. Also Toothless has a way for the dramatics. Why did he wait to reveal he saved Hiccup?
There’s no way that the fire on Toothless’ tail wouldn’t have gone out at the speed they were flying. But god damn that was one hell of a fight scene.
I mean this scene is intense for sure, but they are the main characters. So thanks movie for trying to trick me into thinking that they are going to die. https://t.co/qUfDihCkwv

How dumb are the Vikings for thinking that unleashing the dragons into the world is the same as killing them?! Incredibly stupid, right? Also this final boss dragon is so Indominus Rex that I’m legitimately expecting a Megalodon to eat it.

I think Pixar just copied How To Train Your Dragon to create Brave. Maybe changed the gender of a few characters. It’s the only time in Dreamworks history where I feel they beat Pixar. My point is 
How To Train Your Dragon > Brave
Even in an fantastically animated kids movie, Jay Baruchel still had an awkward romantic scene with the love interest.
the animation is gorgeous, but why is that in every animated movie, there’s like 5% of the movie to justify the 3D version that has absolutely nothing to do with the story?
@DevinColson @The_5th_Turtle That movie is effing amazing https://t.co/GV0vZW2WTq
I really like this movie so far, but Hiccup is a little too Jay Baruchel sometimes. Just like the Jonah Hill character is too Jonah Hill.
@The_5th_Turtle And that’s only just the beginning
@DevinColson Oh ok. Man, this is pretty good storytelling the way the connect them from the start.
@The_5th_Turtle When Hiccup first took down Toothless the crash torn off a piece of his tail to help him fly. Without that winged part of his tail Toothless can’t fly away
@DevinColson I saw what you mean about Toothless’ tail. Was it born that way or was it from a battle?
@The_5th_Turtle Toothless is an adorable badass dragon
That’s so heartwarming to see Hiccup fix Toothless’ tail. https://t.co/NNGnuETq2I
I get them making Toothless more cute for a children’s movie, but this might be too cute. Awww never mind. He’s adorably awesome. https://t.co/emPusekUBz

@DevinColson Hahahaha well I’m not defending it’s animation although it’s insane. They switched from like 3 different animation styles. It was kinda impressive. But I actually enjoyed it’s Bay shit crazy story. It’s not good, but I can’t call it bad either.
Wait all dragons have a weak spot?! Like a video game boss fight? Is that even possible for dragons to have weak spots?! You know, due to things like evolution?
@The_5th_Turtle It really is ! I just don’t understand why Dreamworks could go from something as amazing as HTTYD to something as utter crap like Boss Baby
@DevinColson Oh ok. I will say the animation in this movie is outstanding. Far better than anything I’ve seen from Dreamworks
@The_5th_Turtle A little thing I’ll tell about Toothless is pay close attention to his tail & you’ll see why
@DevinColson He just met Toothless for the first time. He saw him trying to fly & keep falling.
@The_5th_Turtle Wait which part are you on now ?
@DevinColson Wait, is the dragon supposedly “killed” toothless?
@The_5th_Turtle Well know you what happens to Toothless
I know they’re a ruthless Viking village, but how do they know that this dragon won’t kill these kids? This is the Viking version of the X-Men’s danger room.

@DevinColson Oh. I forgot about Kung Fu Panda. I saw the 1st one. I kinda like that one. But I always felt bad for Dreamworks because every year Pixar would make a slightly similar, but way better movie. Dreamworks isn’t bad by any means, but Pixar always had better storytelling.
@The_5th_Turtle Oh and the HTTYD franchise is like top tier Dreamworks
@The_5th_Turtle Oh but if there’s any other Dreamworks stuff to watch over on Netflix definitely check out their take on Voltron !
This movie is gonna completely overlook the fact that Hiccup totally killed one of the strongest dragons. Is no one even gonna check on that?

@The_5th_Turtle There’s some good, like the Kung Fu Panda trilogy, & some mediocre like Trolls. The last Dreamworks movie I saw in theaters was Kung Fu Panda 3 that there shows you how many of their films I’ve seen
@DevinColson Yep. Other then Shrek, Unfortunately I missed a lot of the Dreamworks animated movies.
Why is this lame ass dragon even allowing Hiccup’s Dad to kick it in the face? He has wings? And fire breath. Lame ass dragon.
@The_5th_Turtle This is your first time watching ?! Boy you are in for a treat & with its sequel !
So did his father give him the ironic name Hiccup or did the screenwriter do that?
